results.title: Bridging the gap: the many worlds of Mandawuy (A)
results.creator_credit: Kevin Ryder, John Walsh and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face the press”.
Paolo Totaro hosts a discussion between Rhoda Roberts (Vox Populi), Sonia Voumard (The Age) and Mandawauy Yunupingu (teacher, musican, ambassador and father), on the eve of National Aborigines Day. Mandawuy explores the ways he is bridging the gap between black and white culture through both his band Yothu Yindi, the first aboriginal band to make the charts and to sign with an American record company; and as the Principal of the Yirrkala Community School in North East Arnhem Land, where, as the first aboriginal headmaster, he devised the curriculum mix of aboriginal and western studies known as “Both Ways Education”.

results.title: The Dalai Lama of Tibet
results.creator_credit: Austin Steele, John Walsh and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face the press”.
The Dalai Lama answers questions at a press conference in Perth as part of his Australian tour. He discusses his philosophy of compassion in relation to conflict and political struggle, with particular reference to the Chinese invasion of Tibet. He also provides a brief outline of the events arising from the Chinese invasion. The Dalai Lama is the spiritual leader of the Tibetan people and an inspiration to thousands around the world. He has been living in exile since 1959.

results.title: Living in Two Worlds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face Australia”.
Looks at a suburban industrial “ghetto” in Wollongong which is made up almost entirely of migrants.

results.title: A Lesson to us all
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face Australia”.
Outwardly, Japan is an economic and industrial giant, whose growth from the ashes of WWII into a powerful trading nation is a remarkable success story. This film looks at both sides of the Japanese story, contrasting the nation’s material wealth and manufacturing efficiency with the divisions created by changed social conditions, the tragic effects of uncontrolled pollution and pessimistic outlooks of concerned citizens.

results.title: Horse
results.creator_credit: Justine Kershaw, Ben Southwell, Oregon Public Broadcasting, Dorling Kindersley Vision, Wildvision and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Eyewitness”.
Horses are an important part of the history of civilisation. Humankind harnessed the energy but never mastered the beast. The fifth fastest land mammal, the horse is the “Marathon” winner of the animal kingdom, renown for its strength and endurance. This program looks at the physionomy of the horse and different horse species such as zebras and donkeys. The horse has occupied a place not only in the history of human beings but in our myths, legends and superstitions. Stunning photography and a behind-the-scenes-look at the making of the program ensure this program is an enriching experience for all ages.

results.title: Patterns of heredity
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Eye on Research”.
What happens to human cells in certain cases of blood cancer? Can mongolism be inherited? What makes us grow old? In this study of the research being made into heredity, questions such as these are considered.
